definition: to dominate (a market etc)/to monopolize
alone/independent/single/sole/only
variant of 霸[ba4]
hegemon/tyrant/lord/feudal chief/to rule by force/to usurp/(in modern advertising) master
to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom

sentences.english: In the game's history, the Japanese monopolizing the world for a long time.
sentences.chinese: 在游戏的历史中，日本独霸了整个世界很久。

sentences.english: Gemini grabs both turkey wings for themselves.
sentences.chinese: 双子座独霸了两个鸡翅。

sentences.english: From your explanation Ishall easily handle it.
sentences.chinese: 听了你的说明，尔将易于独霸它。

sentences.english: The days of U.S. global economic dominance are numbered.
sentences.chinese: 美国独霸全球经济主导地位的日子已屈指可数了。

sentences.english: We're We re monopolizing the market now.
sentences.chinese: 我们现在是独霸了整个市场。

sentences.english: Regional newspapers cultivated cosy monopolies and routinely enjoyed annual profit margins of more than 20%.
sentences.chinese: 地方报纸独霸一方，独享每年超过20%的盈利。

sentences.english: But, 3 post program of dominate exclusively government, also let Confucius feel heavy resistance.
sentences.chinese: 但是，三桓独霸朝纲，也让孔子感受到了重重阻力。

sentences.english: Dispossessing the homestead or sharing harmoniously?
sentences.chinese: 是家园独霸还是和谐共享？

to exercise sole hegemony (idiom); to dominate a whole area (market, resources etc)/to hold as one's personal fiefdom
to unify/unified
a powerful chief of the princes of the Spring and Autumn Period (770-476 BC)/overlord/hegemon
to seize/to take away forcibly/to wrest control of/to compete or strive for/to force one's way through/to leave out/to lose
benefit from others' dispute (idiom)
to contend for hegemony/a power struggle
lit. only one branch of the tree is thriving (idiom)/fig. to be in a league of one's own/outstanding
to fight over/to contest/to vie over
to enjoy market dominance/to monopolize
to take back (forcibly)/to recapture/to win back
to control/to dominate/to monopolize
